name: Path M
title: Pathologic M
notes:
**Note 1:**  The lesser sac of the peritoneum, or omental bursa, is the cavity in the abdomen formed by the lesser and greater omentum; the pancreas forms part of the posterior wall of the lesser sac.

**Note 2:**  Celiac axis and splenic nodes are classified as distant for TNM 7th staging.  These nodes are now coded in distant metastasis.
rows:
Distant lymph nodes:
    Celiac
    Pancreaticosplenic (pancreaticolienal)
    Splenic (lineal), NOS
        Splenic hilum
        Splenic artery
        Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), left
        Suprapancreatic 
     Distant lymph nodes, NOS

Seeding of peritoneum, even if limited to the lesser sac region; positive peritoneal cytology

Carcinomatosis

Distant metastasis WITH or WITHOUT distant lymph nodes 

Distant metastasis, NOS  

Stated as M1
